thread.title: Today’s Bay Area arts and entertainment picks, Oct. 26
thread.title_full: Today’s Bay Area arts and entertainment picks, Oct. 26 - SFGate

author: sfgate.com
title: Today’s Bay Area arts and entertainment picks, Oct. 26
text:
Walk the Moon: The pop band from Ohio, famous for the hit “Shut Up and Dance,” makes a stop in San Francisco. 8 p.m. The Masonic, S.F. www.sfmasonic.com. 
“Figuratively Speaking”: Actor and professional artist Lorraine Olsen reprises her Best of Fringe solo recounting what goes on in the mind of a nude model while posing. Yes, you may bring your sketchpad. 8 p.m. Monday, Oct. 26. Through Tuesday, Oct. 27. Shotgun Cabaret, Ashby Stage, 1901 Ashby Ave., Berkeley. (510) 841-6500. www.shotgunplayers.org. 
Left Coast Chamber Ensemble : “With You in Mind,” featuring chamber works written for particular performers by Kaija Saariaho , Eric Zivian, Francis Poulenc and others. 8 p.m. San Francisco Conservatory of Music , 50 Oak St., S.F. www.leftcoastensemble.org.
